Core

class rxrmask.core.Atom(Z, name, ff, ffm=None, mass=None)[source]

Represents an atomic species for X-ray reflectometry calculations.

This class stores atomic properties including atomic number, name, form factors, and atomic mass. The atomic mass is automatically loaded from a database if not provided.

Z

Atomic number.

Type:

int

name

Chemical symbol of the atom (e.g., ‘Fe’, ‘O’).

Type:

str

ff

X-ray form factor model for the atom.

Type:

FormFactorModel

ffm

Magnetic form factor model for the atom. Defaults to None.

Type:

FormFactorModel | None

mass

Atomic mass in atomic mass units (g/mol). Automatically loaded if not provided.

Type:

float | None

Raises:

  • TypeError – If ff is not an instance of FormFactorModel.

  • NameError – If atomic mass cannot be found in the database.

load_atomic_mass()[source]

Load atomic mass from the materials database.

Searches for the atomic mass in the atomic_mass.txt file based on the atom’s name (chemical symbol).

Returns:

Atomic mass in atomic mass units (g/mol).

Return type:

float

Raises:

NameError – If the atom’s name is not found in the database.

class rxrmask.core.Compound(id, name, formula, thickness, base_density, base_m_density=0.0, base_roughness=0.0, n_layers=1, id_layer_init=0, id_layer_end=0, formula_struct=<factory>, magnetic=False, magnetic_direction='0')[source]

Represents a chemical compound in a multilayer structure.

This class encapsulates all properties of a chemical compound including its composition, physical properties, and structural parameters. It can represent both magnetic and non-magnetic.

Type:

Base density in g/cm³.

Type:

Base molar density in mol/cm³. Defaults to 0.0.

Type:

float

Base interface roughness in Angstroms. Defaults to 0.0.

Type:

float

n_layers

Number of layers in the compound. Defaults to 1.

Type:

int

id_layer_init

Initial layer ID. Defaults to 0.

Type:

int

id_layer_end

Final layer ID. Defaults to 0.

Type:

class rxrmask.core.FitParameter(id, name, value=None, init_value=None, min_value=None, max_value=None)[source]

Parameter class designed for optimization and fitting procedures.

This class extends Parameter to support fitting operations by adding initial values, bounds constraints, and fit toggling capabilities. It’s designed to work with optimization algorithms that require parameter bounds and initial guesses.

init_value

Initial value for fitting. Defaults to None.

min_value

Minimum allowed value during fitting. Defaults to None.

max_value

Maximum allowed value during fitting. Defaults to None.

Inherits:

All attributes and methods from Parameter class.

get(prray=None)[source]

Get the parameter value from a parameter array.

Retrieves the parameter value from the provided parameter array using the parameter’s ID as an index. This is used during fitting when parameters are stored in arrays.

Parameters:

prray – Parameter array containing current values during fitting.

Return type:

None

Returns:

The parameter value from the array at index self.id.

set_fit_range(init_value, min_value, max_value)[source]

Set the fitting range and initial value for the parameter.

Configures the parameter for fitting by setting initial value and bounds. The current parameter value is updated to the initial value.

Parameters:

  • init_value (None) – Initial value for fitting. Must be int or float if not None.

  • min_value (None) – Minimum allowed value during fitting.

  • max_value (None) – Maximum allowed value during fitting.

Raises:

TypeError – If init_value is not None and not int or float.

Return type:

None

toggle_fit()[source]

Toggle the fitting state of the parameter.

Switches the fit flag between True and False, enabling or disabling the parameter for fitting procedures.

Return type:

None

class rxrmask.core.FormFactorLocalDB(element, is_magnetic=False)[source]

Form factor model using local database files.

This class implements the FormFactorModel interface for reading atomic form factors from local text files. It supports both regular and magnetic form factors, automatically loading the appropriate data based on the element and magnetic properties.

Type:

str | None

read_data()[source]

Read form factor data from the local database.

Loads form factor data from a text file based on the element name and magnetic properties. The data is stored in a pandas DataFrame with columns for energy (E), real part (f1), and imaginary part (f2).

Raises:

  • ValueError – If no element is specified.

  • FileNotFoundError – If the form factor data file does not exist.

get_index_of_refraction(energy_eV)[source]

Calculate the complex refractive index of the layer.

Parameters:

energy_eV (float) – X-ray energy in electron volts.

Returns:

Complex refractive index n = 1 - δ + iβ where:

  • δ (delta) is the real part of the refractive index decrement

  • β (beta) is the imaginary part related to absorption

Return type:

complex

get_magnetic_optical_constant(energy_eV)[source]

Calculate the magnetic optical constant of the layer.

Parameters:

energy_eV (float) – X-ray energy in electron volts.

Returns:

Magnetic optical constant Q = 2(q1 + iq2) where:

  • q1 is the real part of the magnetic optical constant

  • q2 is the imaginary part related to magnetic absorption

Return type:

complex

class rxrmask.core.ParametersContainer(parameters=<factory>, fit_parameters=<factory>)[source]

Container for managing collections of parameters and fit parameters.

This class provides a centralized way to manage both regular parameters and fit parameters used in X-ray reflectometry modeling and fitting. It includes factory methods for creating new parameters and utilities for extracting parameter vectors for optimization algorithms.

parameters

List of regular parameters.

Type:

list[Parameter]

fit_parameters

List of parameters available for fitting.

Type:

list[FitParameter]

Extract initial values from fit parameters that are enabled for fitting.

Creates a vector of initial values from all fit parameters that have their fit flag set to True. This is typically used to initialize optimization algorithms.

Returns:

List of initial values from enabled fit parameters.

Return type:

list

class rxrmask.core.Structure(name, n_compounds)[source]

Represents a complete multilayer structure for X-ray reflectometry.

This class manages the organization of compounds into a multilayer structure, handles the discretization into thin layers, and provides methods for generating density profiles. It serves as the main container that connects the material definitions (compounds) with the computational representation (layers).

name

Human-readable name for the structure.

Type:

str

n_compounds

Number of compounds in the structure. Defaults to 0.

Type:

int

n_layers

Number of discretized layers. Defaults to 0.

Type:

int

layers

List of discretized Layer objects.

Type:

list[Layer]

compounds

List of Compound objects, may contain None entries.

Type:

list[Compound | None]

add_compound(index, compound)[source]

Add a compound to the structure at the specified index. Index 0 represents the substrate layer, and subsequent indices represent the layers above it in the multilayer structure.

Parameters:

  • index (int) – Position index where the compound should be added (0-based).

  • compound (Compound) – The Compound object to add to the structure.

Raises:

  • IndexError – If index is outside the valid range [0, n_compounds).

  • TypeError – If compound is not a Compound instance.

create_layers(step=0.1)[source]

Create discretized layers from the compound definitions.

Generates a series of thin layers by discretizing the compound structure based on the density profile. Each layer contains the appropriate atomic elements with their calculated densities at that position.

This method transforms the compound-based description into a layer-based representation.

Parameters:

step (float, optional) – Discretization step size in Angstroms. Smaller values give higher resolution but more layers. Defaults to 0.1.

get_density_profile(step=0.1)[source]

Generate density profiles for all atomic species in the structure.

Calculates the spatial distribution of atomic densities throughout the structure, taking into account interface roughness and gradual transitions between compounds. This method provides the fundamental data needed for optical constant calculations.

Parameters:

step (float, optional) – Spatial resolution for the density profile in Angstroms. Smaller values provide higher resolution. Defaults to 0.1.

Returns:

A 4-tuple containing:

  • z (np.ndarray): Spatial positions in Angstroms.

  • dens (dict): Regular density profiles for each atomic species.

  • m_dens (dict): Magnetic density profiles for each atomic species.

  • atoms (dict): Dictionary mapping element names to Atom objects.

Return type:

tuple

Raises:

ValueError – If any compound in the structure is None (undefined).

rxrmask.core.create_compound(id, name, thickness, density, formula, atoms_prov, roughness=None, m_density=None)[source]

Create a Compound object from a chemical formula and properties.

Parses a chemical formula string and creates a complete Compound object with calculated atomic layer structures. The function automatically calculates molar densities for each atomic species based on their stoichiometric fractions and atomic masses.

Parameters:

  • id (str) – Unique identifier for the compound.

  • name (str) – Human-readable name of the compound.

  • thickness (float) – Total thickness of the compound in Angstroms.

  • density (float) – Base density of the compound in g/cm³.

  • formula (str) – Chemical formula in the format “Element1:count1,Element2:count2” (e.g., “Fe:1,O:3” for Fe₂O₃).

  • atoms_prov (list[Atom]) – List of available Atom objects to use in the compound.

  • roughness (float | None, optional) – Interface roughness in Angstroms. Defaults to None.

  • m_density (float | None, optional) – Magnetic density in mol/cm³. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A complete Compound object with calculated atomic layer structures.

Return type:

Compound

Raises:

ValueError – If an atom symbol from the formula is not found in atoms_prov.

Example

>>> atoms = [fe_atom, o_atom]  # Pre-defined Atom objects
>>> compound = create_compound("fe2o3", "Iron Oxide", 50.0, 5.24, "Fe:2,O:3", atoms)

Parameters:

  • symbol (str) – Chemical symbol to search for (e.g., ‘Fe’, ‘O’).

  • atoms (list[Atom]) – List of Atom objects to search through.

Returns:

The first Atom object with matching symbol, or None if not found.

Return type:

Atom | None

This module provides the Atom class and related utilities for representing atomic species in X-ray reflectometry calculations.

rxrmask.core.compound.create_compound(id, name, thickness, density, formula, atoms_prov, roughness=None, m_density=None)[source]

Create a Compound object from a chemical formula and properties.

Parses a chemical formula string and creates a complete Compound object with calculated atomic layer structures. The function automatically calculates molar densities for each atomic species based on their stoichiometric fractions and atomic masses.

Parameters:

  • id (str) – Unique identifier for the compound.

  • name (str) – Human-readable name of the compound.

  • thickness (float) – Total thickness of the compound in Angstroms.

  • density (float) – Base density of the compound in g/cm³.

  • formula (str) – Chemical formula in the format “Element1:count1,Element2:count2” (e.g., “Fe:1,O:3” for Fe₂O₃).

  • atoms_prov (list[Atom]) – List of available Atom objects to use in the compound.

  • roughness (float | None, optional) – Interface roughness in Angstroms. Defaults to None.

  • m_density (float | None, optional) – Magnetic density in mol/cm³. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A complete Compound object with calculated atomic layer structures.

Return type:

Compound

Raises:

ValueError – If an atom symbol from the formula is not found in atoms_prov.

Example

>>> atoms = [fe_atom, o_atom]  # Pre-defined Atom objects
>>> compound = create_compound("fe2o3", "Iron Oxide", 50.0, 5.24, "Fe:2,O:3", atoms)

class rxrmask.core.structure.Structure(name, n_compounds)[source]

Represents a complete multilayer structure for X-ray reflectometry.

This class manages the organization of compounds into a multilayer structure, handles the discretization into thin layers, and provides methods for generating density profiles. It serves as the main container that connects the material definitions (compounds) with the computational representation (layers).

name

add_compound(index, compound)[source]

Add a compound to the structure at the specified index. Index 0 represents the substrate layer, and subsequent indices represent the layers above it in the multilayer structure.

Parameters:

  • index (int) – Position index where the compound should be added (0-based).

  • compound (Compound) – The Compound object to add to the structure.

Raises:

  • IndexError – If index is outside the valid range [0, n_compounds).

  • TypeError – If compound is not a Compound instance.

create_layers(step=0.1)[source]

Create discretized layers from the compound definitions.

Generates a series of thin layers by discretizing the compound structure based on the density profile. Each layer contains the appropriate atomic elements with their calculated densities at that position.

This method transforms the compound-based description into a layer-based representation.

Parameters:

step (float, optional) – Discretization step size in Angstroms. Smaller values give higher resolution but more layers. Defaults to 0.1.

get_density_profile(step=0.1)[source]

Generate density profiles for all atomic species in the structure.

Calculates the spatial distribution of atomic densities throughout the structure, taking into account interface roughness and gradual transitions between compounds. This method provides the fundamental data needed for optical constant calculations.

Parameters:

step (float, optional) – Spatial resolution for the density profile in Angstroms. Smaller values provide higher resolution. Defaults to 0.1.

Returns:

A 4-tuple containing:

  • z (np.ndarray): Spatial positions in Angstroms.

  • dens (dict): Regular density profiles for each atomic species.

  • m_dens (dict): Magnetic density profiles for each atomic species.

  • atoms (dict): Dictionary mapping element names to Atom objects.

Return type:

tuple

Raises:

ValueError – If any compound in the structure is None (undefined).
